column2: A lamp being moved side-to-side by a police officer ahas the same meaning as the red light of a traffic signal for all direction of the vehicles.
When proceeding near an intersection, and an emergency vehicle approaches you, you should move away from the intersection, move to the left side of the road and proceed at a reduced speed.
It is prohibited to drive in lined-up group of more than two vehicles, because doing so would be regarded as the reckless driving of so-called "automobile gangs."

Even when you are moving at a reduced speed keeping a short distance form the vehicle in front because the traffic ahead is heavily congested, you must not stop inside the pavement marking shown on the left.
When you proceed through a railroad crossing in succession to the vehicle in front, you must still stop and confirm safety.
The sign shown on the right, which is attached at the bottom of the main traffic sign, refers to the starting point of the traffic regulation indicated by the main traffic sign.
If safety to the front, back left and right is ensured before giving a signal to start, the driver need not check it again.
After overtaking  a vehicle, you should move back to the left lane as quickly as possible.
Do not lend your car to a person who has had even a little to drink and who may drive later.
Vehicles may drive across bicycle crossings when entering or exiting an establishment located on the other side of it.
When passing a stopped vehicles, drivers are not required to check whether there are people in the vehicle.

When there are three or more vehicular lanes provided for traffic traveling in the same direction, vehicles must choose one of the lanes, other than the right most lane, to proceed depending on the speed they are traveling at.

A truck was parked on your side of the road and a regular-size motorcycle was coming toward you in the oncoming vehicular lane. You accelerated to pass the truck before the motorcycle had passed the section of the road where the truck was parked.
Vehicles and mopeds are prohibited from overtaking other vehicles at or within 40 meters of pedestrian crossings or bicycle crossings.

When a vehicle attempts to make a right turn at an intersection and there is an oncoming two–wheeled vehicle attempting to proceed straight through, the vehicle attempting to turn right has the right of way and may proceed first.
Drivers must sound the horn at any intersection where visibility is poor, even if it is outside of zones denoted by a
You may not stop or park within the areas where the sidewalk is marked as shown on the left, except when you stop in conformity with a traffic light indication or to avoid danger.
Mini car is a regular vehicle so it is not probated on the expressway.

When you drive by a pedestrian using a white cane or a walking aid, an elderly person or a physically-disabled person having difficulty walking, you must stop or slow down in order to ensure the safety of these people.
The signal for making a U-turn is the same for that of a right turn.
Overthinking is prohibited inside tunnels even if the tunnels have vehicular lanes.
When passing a pedestrian the vehicle must maintain a safe distance, or otherwise proceed slowly.
A police officer's hand signal as shown in the figure has the same meaning as the yellow traffic light of a traffic signal for traffic proceeding in the direction of the arrows.
When driving across a pedestrian crossing or a bicycle crossing, you must always stop before the crossing even when there are no pedestrians or bicycles.

When proceeding behind a vehicle, a driver must maintain enough distance between vehicles so as to avoid colliding with the vehicle ahead if it stops suddenly.  In that case, when the vehicles are proceeding faster, the distance must be larger.
Where this traffic sign as indicated, you must proceed while reducing to a speed at which you can come to an immediate halt.
A driver may select any type of clothing for driving as long as he or she is not naked.
A driver slowed down and passed by a school bus which had stopped to let children get on and off the bus.
It is in not advisable to shift lanes too often on roads with vehicular lanes, because doing so would inconvenience the vehicles behind and may induce accidents.
Overtaking is prohibited at a railway crossing or within 30 meters before one.
On roads regulated by the traffic sign shown on the left, the rider of a large- or regular-size motorcycles may not ride double.
When crossing a road that has right of way, or a road that is wider than the one you are traveling, you must slow down and avoid impeding the traffic flow of the cross road.
A driver overtake a truck inside a tunnel with vehicular lanes.
A vehicle may cross to the right to a minimum extent when it cannot proceed on the left side of the road due to road constructions, road damage or other similar situations.
When overtaking, a vehicle should pass on the right side of the vehicle ahead, unless the vehicle ahead is in the center of the road in order to make a right turn.
A person who obtains only a regular driver's license may not ride a large-size motorcycle or a regular motorcycle.
A pavement marking as shown in the figure designates a "no stopping zone."
A signal for turning right or left must be given 30 meters in advance of making the turn.
Yellow pavement markings indicate stronger regulations than those indicated with white pavement markings.

When the traffic ahead is heavily congested and you do not think it is possible to pass through a pedestrian crossing or a railroad crossing once you enter it. You must stay behind the crossing even when the traffic light turn green because a green light does not mean to "Proceed."
On a road where there are no vehicular lanes designated, automobiles may proceed anywhere to the left of the centerline of the road.
Only streetcars may make a left turn at a traffic signal as shown in the figure.
You should adjust the driver's seat of the four-wheeled vehicle so that your knee is stretched out when you step on the clutch pedal.

When a police officer is making a hand signal with his/her arms held out straight to the sides horizontally on a road without a pedestrian crossing or similar situation other than at an intersection, vehicles facing the police officer must stop 1 meter before him/her.
This traffic sign shown on the left is one of the warning signs designating a "Pedestrian Crossing" ahead.
When driving with a child on board, you do not have to use a child seat, if the child is sick, or if the child objects to using it.
When passing a route bus that has stopped at a bus station, it is reasonable to assume that people may come out from the back of the bus at any time.
When making a left turn at an intersection, a driver must be careful because the rear wheels might hit pedestrians or cyclists due to a wheelbase differential.
If one drives without carrying a driver's license, it is regarded as driving without a valid license even if he or she is licensed.
Vehicles and streetcars facing a signal as shown in the figure cannot proceed beyond the stopping position.
In areas regulated by these traffic signs shown, pedestrians and bicycles may pass through.
Regulatory signs prohibit specific driving conduct, or designated drivers and pedestrians to observe specific traffic regulations.
On a road where the road and the sidewalks are not separated, vehicles must slow down when passing near a pedestrian.
You must proceed on the left side of roads without vehicular lanes, except when you attempt to overtake other vehicles.
You may reduce  speed sufficiently to allow you to stop any time where you pass through bicycle crossings.
When you shift lanes in order to enter a building located alongside the road, you must signal 30 meters in advance of changing lanes.

Before proceeding therough a railroad crossing where visibility is good drivers are not required to bring their vehicles to a complete stop just before the railroad crossing (or just before the stop line if present) they may proceed after slowing down and ensuring safety.
At intersections where traffic signs and pavement markings indicate the direction such as straight and left turn, vehicles may proceed only in the direction indicated.
When following another vehicle, the driver must keep a sufficient distance between vehicles to avoid colliding with the vehicle ahead if it comes to a sudden stop.
Two-wheeled vehicles  may always proceed in the exclusive lane for route buses, it there are no route buses in the vicinity.
When you change lanes while proceeding in the same direction, you do not have to signal because changing lanes is different form turning right or left.

Novice drivers (those driving for less than one year on a regular driver's license) are obliged to display a "novice driver sign" in order to have drivers in the vicinity notice and watch out for them.
The drivers of all vehicles must not only observe the traffic rules but also take out automobile insurance as a measure of precaution and always have first-aid tools at hand.
When proceeding on a road without a halfway line, you should proceed along the center of the road because a pedestrian may dash out onto the street at any moment.
You may overtake a vehicle proceeding ahead of you at a corner of the road with sufficient space for overtaking.
Serving or offering alcohol to someone who will soon be driving is prohibited.
Overtaking mopeds is permitted, even where overtaking other vehicles is prohibited.
In areas where vehicular lanes are separated by a yellow line, you may cross over the halfway line to make a right or left turn.

When proceeding behind a large-size motorcycle on a road where it is regulated to "Sounding Zone" you sounded the car horn to let an oncoming vehicle know your vehicle was approaching the corner of the road.
If an emergency automobile approaches, vehicles near an intersection must move to the left side of the road and come to a stop outside the intersection.
When the traffic light you are facing indicates a flashing yellow light, you must first come to a halt and then proceed while exercising caution.
You can drive even if you have only had a little to drink
In areas are regulated by this traffic sign, no vehicles may pass through.
If the cross street is a road with a right of way or is wider, a vehicle must stop completely and must not obstruct the progress of the crossing traffic.
The pavement marking shown in the figure designates that vehicles must not enter this area.
The correct time to signal to move into the left lane while traveling straight is when the driver is about to turn the steering wheel.
On roads regulated by this traffic sign shown on the left, vehicles proceeding in the lane 3 must not proceed straight or execute a left turn.
A driver must start the vehicle immediately after a traffic signal turns green, because the green signal designates "must proceed."

When passing beside a pedestrian, who is visually-impaired and walking with a white or yellow cane, you must stop or slow down when driving past him/her, and should never impede the progress of that person; however, if a visually implied person is walking with the aid of a seeing-eye dog, he/she is regarded as an ordinary pedestrian and so stopping or slowing down in not required.
The stopping distance of vehicle refers to distance consisting of reaction distance and the braking distance.
A hand signal as shown in the figure, with the arm extended diagonally downward from the vehicle, is used to indicate that the vehicle is reversing.
A vehicle is not required to stop when proceeding through a railway crossing with an alarm if the alarm is not sounding
You do not need to be concerned about other drivers or pedestrians in the traffic as long as you are observing the traffic rules.
To overtake, the driver must first turn on the right turn signal while moving to the right side, and then check the situation behind.
The pavement markings shown on the left designate that there is either a pedestrian crossing or a bicycle crossing ahead.

People who have been licensed for driving large vehicles are qualified to drive large vehicles, medium-size vehicles, semi medium-size vehicles, regular vehicles, large size motorcycles, light special equipment, and mopeds (motorized bicycle).
A person with a motorized bicycle license is not permitted to drive a vehicle with engine displacement of exceeding 50 cc.
Vehicles may not use the vehicular lane regulated by this traffic sign shown on the left, even when the traffic is light and you do not see any route buses in the vicinity.
You must always observe the traffic light you are facing, and you may not start moving forward when the traffic light facing the cross road turns red.

When there is a pedestrian who is about to cross at a pedestrian crossing, a vehicle may sound the horn to alert the pedestrian after making a stop and proceed through the crossing before the pedestrian starts crossing if the driver is in a hurry.
When overtaking a vehicle proceeding near the center line for executing a right turn, vehicles must pass on the right side of that vehicle.
A driver proceeded in the manner depicted by the arrow and tool a U-turn on the road where there were pavement markings shown on the left.
When vehicular lanes are designated by a yellow line, vehicles must not cross the line, even when making a left or right turn.
Large motorcycles and regular motorcycles, excluding motorized bicycles, must not proceed on a road with a traffic sign as shown in the figure.
When a police officer gives this had signal shown in the diagram, the traffic coming from the directions indicated by the arrows, may proceed.
When you proceed beside a safety zone, you must slow down even when there is no pedestrian inside.
You must not overtake or pass other vehicles ( with the exception of light vehicles) at or within 30 meters of the pedestrian crossing or bicycle crossing.
When moving into traffic from the edge of the road, it is not particularly necessary to signal if the driver makes sure there are no vehicles approaching from the rear.
The stopping distance refers to the distance from the point at which the brakes are applied to the point at which the vehicle comes to a complete halt.
When there is no stop line at an intersection regulated by traffic light, you are supposed to stop right before the traffic light.
Once you have passed the driver's license examination, you may operate a vehicles on public roads even before the issuance of your driver's license.
When entering a railroad crossing with  good view, you do not have to stop before entering if you can assure safety.
A steep downward slope is suitable for overtaking because it is easy to accelerate.
For the traffic approaching the intersection from the direction indicated by the arrows shown in the diagram, the hand signal of police officer is equivalent to yellow traffic sign.
The brakes work in conjunction with the brake lights, so it is not advisable to stop on the brake pedal several times in succession to alert the vehicle behind.
It is prohibited to cross or make a U-turn on roads regulated by this traffic sign shown on the left.
Even on roads having on intersections nearby, you must stop to  give way to an approaching emergency vehicle.
The pavement markings shown on the left prohibit vehicles proceeding on Vehicular Lane A from moving into Vehicular Lane B, and vice versa.
When making a left turn, a vehicle must initially approach the intersection as close to the left edge of the road as possible and pass around the curb of the intersection while slowing down.
You do not have to observe that hand signals of a traffic warden because he/she is not a police officer.

When passing a vehicle stopped on the road, a driver must ensure safety, slow down or maintain enough space between his or her vehicle and the stopped vehicle, and anticipate that a door of the vehicle may suddenly open.
Correct posture of motorcycle, shoulders relax and your elbows should be slightly bent.
A traffic sign as shown in the figure indicates that two roads will merge and the road will become wider.
When starting the vehicle, it is advisable for a driver to check the vehicle's surroundings, give a signal that you are about to move, and check the safety around the vehicle again after the signal.
On a road with a traffic sign as shown in the figure, there are humps or dips ahead.
In areas designated by this traffic sign, you must drive at a reduced speed before hand so as not to apply brakes.
When you catch up with a route bus, which has stopped at a bus station,  you must wait behind the bus until it starts to move forward.
When being overtaken, you may not increase your speed until the vehicle has completely finished overtaking your vehicle.
A pavement marking as shown in the figure indicates no parking.
When parking your vehicle in a parking space, it is advisable to enter the space head-on, and exit by backing up.
People over the age of 16 may apply for a license for large-size motorcycle.
Where the maximum speed limit is not indicated by traffic signs, etc., drivers are permitted to travel at any speed that they feel is safe.
The signal to be given when moving into traffic after parking at the left edge of the road is the same as that given when intending to move into the lane to the right while traveling straight.
Selecting a two wheeled vehicle should be about to walk a full figure of eight.
Where there are yellow markings on the curbstones of a pedestrian walkway as shown in the diagram, you may not part or stop in these areas.

When you catch up with a streetcar, which has stopped at a streetcar station so as to let the passengers get on and off, you must wait behind; however, when there is a safety zone provided you may proceed  at the same speed without having to slow down even it there are passengers getting on and off.
An automobile may overtake an automobile ahead that is already attempting to overtake another automobile if safety ahead is assured.

A driver violated a traffic regulation while under the probationary novice-driver term, and received notification indicating that he had been listed as a candidate for the novice-driver course provided for those drivers who must take a make-up exam. Under these circumstances, his license would be revoked if he fails the make-up exam.
A driver must wear a seatbelt and make sure that passengers wear one too, because seatbelts can substantially reduce the risk of injuries in the event of a traffic accident.
Vehicles must not enter areas designated by the marking shown on the left.

When a driver passes people with a white or yellow cane, unattended children, senior citizens or others with difficulty walking, he or she may continue to proceed while warning these people by sounding the vehicle's horn.
When beginning to overtake a vehicle ahead, in order to finish within a short distance, move as close as possible to the vehicle and then change lanes.
At an uncontrolled intersection with poor visibility to the left or right, vehicles with right of way must slow down, even when proceeding.
People who have been issued a semi medium-size driver's license may drive, in addition to semi medium-size vehicles, regular vehicles and light special equipment and mopeds (motorized bicycles.)
You do not have to slow down when you pass through a corner of a road with an unobstructed view.
On a road having a halfway line marked with a solid yellow line, you went over the halfway line to overtake the vehicle ahead.
A vehicle may proceed straddling two vehicular lanes when traffic is congested.

A vehicle traveling in a priority lane for route buses, etc., may continue to proceed in the lane when a school bus for nursery school or kindergarten students approaches from behind, as the bus is not a route bus.
If there is an  intersection and police officer giving the hand signal for stop, you must stop one meter before the police officer or traffic warden.
The car horn is very useful because you can sound the car horn when you give a signal to your colleague driving in the opposite direction, or when you want to let others know that you have arrived.
You must always slow down in areas where this sign on the left is designated.
When you drive by a person in a wheelchair, or walking with the aid of a seeing-eye dog, you must stop or slow down.
When you initiate overtaking a vehicle ahead of you, you should keep the distance between your vehicle and the one you are about to overtake as short as possible.
Mini car is a regular vehicle so you may drive on an expressway.
The three keys to driving are identification, judgment and execution. Among them, execution is especially important and deeply related to causes of an accident.
In areas regulated by these traffic signs shown, pedestrians and bicycles may pass through.
You must not drive when you are under the influence of alcohol, but the use of stimulant drugs while driving is recommended because they help you stay alert.
On public roads where a speed limit is not indicated on traffic signs or pavement marking, the maximum speed for vehicles and mopeds (motorized bicycles) is 50km/h.
When overtaking, a vehicle may temporarily exceed the maximum speed limit displayed on traffic signs or designated by regulations.

When the traffic light turns from green to yellow, you may proceed through the intersection even if you can safely come to a halt at the stop line because a yellow light does not indicate the vehicles should stop.
When you change lanes, make U-turns, or back up, you do not have to confirm safety as long as you signal your intention.
Automobiles and mopeds may proceed on the side strip when the road is congested.
Whenever you make a left or right turn, you must slow down.
When braking, a driver must depress the brake pedal as strongly as possible.
There was many kindergarteners walking in the vicinity of a  kinder garden attended by two teachers, so you slowed down and drove past them.
A vehicle must not use a lane where there is priority lane when traffic congestion might prevent the vehicle from leaving the lane immediately if a local bus approaches.
Automobiles facing a traffic signal as shown in the figure may proceed forward and enter the intersection if they slow down and exercise due caution to other traffic.

You kept the photocopies of your vehicle inspection certificate and a compulsory automobile liability insurance certificate (or a mutual relief system insurance certificate) in your automobile instead of the original documents because they were subject to loss and going through the formalities of re-issuance of these documents would be too cumbersome.
It is permitted to drive an automobile, even when one's license is suspended or temporarily suspended, since it has not been revoked if necessary.
When you drive down a slope in a four-wheeled vehicle with automatic transmission, you should activate engine braking by shifting the change lever into either one of 2, L or  1 positions.
Overtaking the vehicle ahead when that vehicle is attempting to overtake another automobile is double overtaking. This type of overtaking is prohibited because it is dangerous.
This sign indicates that there are schools, kindergartens or nursery schools close by.
A vehicle, in principle, must not proceed on streetcar tracks, It is allowed to, however, when crossing streetcar tracks in order to make a left or right turn, or to make a U-turn.
A learner driver with a learner's permit may drive on a public road without passengers.
A driver must sound the vehicle's horn where there is a traffic sign as shown in the figure, even if he or she does not observe danger.
When a vehicle enters or exits an establishment located alongside the road, the vehicle must stop before crossing a pedestrian walkway or a side strip it any.
The traffic sign shown in the diagram indicate that vehicles may park in areas regulated by this traffic sign.
When there are pedestrians or cyclists ahead, drivers must be prepared to turn the steering wheel to avoid colliding with them in case they behave in an unexpected manner.
When a vehicle is passing a cyclist, the same precautions are required as when passing a pedestrian.
When the traffic light you are facing is indicating a flashing red light at an intersection, you must either stop or slow down when approaching the intersection.
When a traffic signal for cross traffic turns red at an intersection, the traffic signal ahead is always green.
Watch the screen of the care navigation system while driving.
In order to make a left turn, regular automobiles may proceed in the leftmost lane even when it is indicated by a traffic sign, etc., as an exclusive lane for route buses.
A green lights means all vehicles may proceed straight ahead  or turn to the left or right.
At an intersection, you must give due caution to vehicles or pedestrians that may be blocked from view by other vehicles.
A driver must choose an appropriate vehicle speed according to the traffic or road conditions, climate or visibility, even when proceeding at a speed within the designated speed limit.
When a child is walking unattended, you must sound the car horn while passing the child.
Throwing an empty can form a moving car would expose other drivers to danger and induce accidents.
When driving a vehicle you must always carry your driver's license with you in case you are asked to show it.

When starting the engine of a four-wheeled vehicle with automatic transmission, you must depress the brake pedal after making sure that the hand brake is engaged ( the hand brake should  not be used in icing regions,) and the change lever is in the " P(Parking)" position.

With a four-wheeled vehicle with automatic transmission, you must be careful when starting the engine or while using the air conditioning because the vehicle may lunge forward due to the increased engine revolutions.

When vehicles ( with the exception of two-wheeled vehicles) proceed on a road having no sidewalk or pedestrian strip, the wheels of the vehicle must remain at least 0.5 meter from the edge of the road.
A person pushing a two-wheeled vehicle with its engine turned off may walk on a pedestrian walkway.

When a police officer has him arms stretched out horizontally, at a location, other than an intersection, with no pedestrian crossing, bicycle crossing, or railroad crossing, the vehicles facing the officer must stop at the position 1 meter from the officer.
If changing lanes will cause the vehicle approaching from behind to brake abruptly or steer sharply, do not change lanes.
If the brake pedal is depressed several times, the brake lamps flash, which serves as a signal to drivers behind. As a result, it can help prevent a rear end accident.

This distance from the point at which the brakes are applied to the position at which the vehicle come to a halt is always constant if driving at the same speed regardless of the conditions of the road surface.
When a vehicle may be forced to stop in an intersection due to congestion and may obstruct the flow of cross-traffic, the vehicle must not enter the intersection, even if the signal is green.
When changing the vehicle movements during driving, is driver must signal and continue signaling until the action is completed.
Motorized bicycles are permitted to proceed on a bicycle path only when there are no bicycles on it.

When proceeding forward at an intersection, the general traffic rule says that vehicles traveling straight ahead have the right of way. Therefore, there is no need for you to worry about such drivers attempting to turn right in front of you by ignoring the rule.
A driver must start signaling about three seconds before intending to change lanes while proceeding in the same direction.
Driving in accordance with traffic regulations helps protect the lives of other people and your own life too.
A traffic sign as shown in the figure indicates Traffic merges from the left
Overtaking or passing automobiles or mopeds is prohibited at pedestrian crossings or bicycle crossings or within 30 meters before one.
When opening the door of the vehicle to get out, first open it slightly while checking the safety to the rear, and ensure safety before fully opening the door.
When a driver is tired, the reaction distance becomes longer because it takes longer for the driver to sense dangerous situations and act accordingly.
Six years old children must use child seat.
When proceeding through an intersection without a traffic light, and the cross road is wider than the one you are driving on, you must slow down regardless of visibility.
Driving before the issuance of a driver's license is equivalent to driving without a license.
A driver must be careful when proceeding on a road where there is a traffic sign as shown in the figure because children might suddenly run onto the road.
This traffic sign shown on the left warns that there is a cross-shaped intersection ahead. You need to sound your horn and as you approach the intersection.
A driver must not drive a vehicle assuming that everyone on the road behaves perfectly. Rather, he or she must always anticipate the possibility of danger.
Do not drive even if you have only had a little to drink
Because there was not any ideal location for hanging up a  store signboard near home, you displayed it into the pole of a traffic  light.
This traffic sign shown on the left refers to "Closed to all vehicles" indicating that vehicles may not pass through the road.

When an emergency vehicles approaches from behind on a one-way street vehicles should move to the right side of the road to yield the road, if moving to the left side of the road could impede the progress of the approaching emergency vehicle.
Flashing red lights mean you may proceed without stopping.
It is meaningless to check for safety prior to getting in vehicle. But instead, it must be done right before moving the vehicle forward or backward.
You must slow down at or around the top of a hill only where it is regulated by a traffic sign.
When you start the engine of a vehicle with automatic transmission, you may shift the change lever to the "N" position, as long as the parking brake is engaged.
A vehicle that has already executed a right turn at an intersection may continue to proceed even when the signal ahead turns red.
When changing to the left or right lane while proceeding in the same direction, a driver is not required to give a signal because that is not executing a left or right turn.
The police officer's hand signal as shown in the figure has the same meaning as a yellow light for traffic proceeding in the direction of the arrows.
As a general rule, where there are two vehicular lanes, both of which are heading in the same direction, vehicles must proceed in the left  vehicular lane.

As long as the driver of a vehicle with automatic transmission understands the basics of driving techniques, he/she can take driving lightly because it poses fewer dangers to the driver compared to driving a vehicle with manual transmission.
While driving motorcycle you may wear construction helmet .
A traffic sign as shown in the figure alerts drivers that the road ahead is slippery.
When you turn left at an intersection, you may proceed ahead of any vehicle attempting to turn right, even if they reached the intersection before you.
When a signal changes  from yellow to red the signal  for cross traffic chances to green immediately, so the cross traffic can proceed right away.
On a road where the roadway and sidewalks are separated, vehicles must, in principle, proceed on the roadway. However, vehicles may proceed on sidewalks when entering or leaving roadside locations.
In cases where the width of the left side of the road is not sufficient to allow the vehicle to proceed, the vehicle may fully or partially enter the right side of the road.

To move to the right side of the road for overtaking, the driver of an automobile must pay full attention to the movement of the vehicle ahead, oncoming vehicles and pedestrians crossing the road ahead.

When proceeding through an uncontrolled intersection with poor visibility to the right and left, a vehicle must proceed slowly to ensure safety, regardless of the width of the road on which the vehicle is traveling.
When applying the brakes, first depress the brake pedal as lightly as possible, and then gradually apply more pressure as needed.
To drive a two-wheeled vehicle you should wear short clothes and expose your body.

When driving on a road having one lane traveling in each direction, a driver crossed over the halfway into the lane provided for the oncoming traffic after making sure that there was no oncoming vehicle because the traffic ahead was heavily congested.

While vehicles are proceeding in succession, and when a vehicle ahead stop at an intersection or a railroad crossing, it is advisable to cut in front of the stopped vehicle to avoid being caught up in the traffic congestion.
You must exercise caution when driving through puddles or on muddy roads, so as not to splash water or mud and get people on the road dirty.
The designated maximum speed on general roads is 60 km/h for automobiles and 30 km/h for mopeds.
While ride a motorcycle, you should be able to touch the ground with the tips of both feet
A traffic sign as shown in the figure indicates - crossing by pedestrians prohibited
You must slow down and must not overtake vehicles ahead of you at and around the top of hills or on steep downward slopes.
Spraying water on the road in front of your house to prevent dust from floating in the air even though the water may freeze as temperatures drop.
On a road with two lanes in each direction, all types of vehicle must proceed in the left lane and keep the right lane free for vehicle overtaking or executing a right turn.
The rider of a moped proceeded at a speed of 50 km/h on a public road with no traffic sign or pavement marking.
A driver must carry his or her driver's license (including learner's permit) while driving a vehicle so as to be able to present it at anytime.
The pavement marking shown in the figure indicates that there is an intersection ahead.
You mush stop vehicle before line while flashing yellow light.
A pavement marking as shown in the figure indicates the location where a "no U-turn" zone ends.
When the traffic light you are facing turns green, you must immediately advance forward under all circumstances.
When the signal ahead is green, a vehicle can proceed into a congested intersection, even if it may be forced to stop within the intersection.

When making a right turn inside an intersection, and there is a two-wheeled approaching, you must exercise due caution because its is difficult to discern the correct distance between you and the oncoming two-wheeled vehicle.
In areas regulated by the traffic sign shown in the diagram, you may neither park nor stop from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.
lf a driver obeys the traffic regulations, he or she might not cause a traffic accident, even if he or she does not consider others' situations.
Vehicles may execute a left turn from a vehicular lane where there is a pavement marking as shown in the figure.
At a railroad crossing regulated by a traffic light, you may cross it  without having to stop or confirm safety before crossing, as long as the traffic light is green.
The rider of large- and regular-size motorcycles has to wear a crash helmet whereas the rider of mopeds does not.
A vehicle must not cross the road or make a U-turn even where there are no "no U-turn" or "no vehicle crossing" signs when it might hinder the normal progress of pedestrians or other vehicles.

At a place other than an intersection and where there is no pedestrian crossing, bicycle crossing or railway crossing, vehicles must stop 3 meters before is police officer or traffic warden who is giving is stop signal.
When proceeding behind a large vehicle, you may straddle the two vehicular lanes, so that you can see the traffic conditions ahead.
In areas regulated by these traffic signs shown, pedestrians and bicycles may pass through.
The driver of a four-wheeled vehicle must lock the doors to prevent the passengers from inadvertently opening them.
If the traffic is light, you are allowed to make a U-turn in areas where "No U-turn" is designated because doing so would not pose any dangers to anyone.

A driver must maintain a safe distance between his or her vehicle and the vehicle ahead, taking the weather, road and tire conditions, and the weight of the cargo loaded into account, so as not to collide with the vehicle ahead if it stops suddenly.
When passing through a railway crossing, it is advisable for a driver not to shift gears and proceed straight through the crossing in the gear used when starting the vehicle.
It would be advisable for a driver not to check the safety to the rear too often, because by doing so the vehicle speed decreases and it may cause traffic congestion.
The proper posture for driving a four-wheel vehicle is to sit leaning against the back of the seat, with your arms stretched out and your hands placed on the steering wheel.
An automobile may overtake an automobile ahead that is attempting to overtake another automobile, if there is an sufficient space.
When there is a school or kindergarten bus and children are getting on and off, a vehicle must slow down to pass the bus while paying attention to children who might suddenly run onto the road.
You must slow down when passing through an intersection, which is regulated by traffic lights and has poor visibility.
A sign as shown in the figure indicates that it is prohibited to proceed in the direction of the arrow.
It is sufficient when driving to obey traffic refutations; there is no need to worry about give-and-take with other drivers and pedestrians.
When overtaking a regular automobile proceeding at 60 kilometers per hour on a road without traffic signs indicating the speed limit, automobiles are permitted to exceed this speed temporarily.
As long as you can check for safety of the traffic ahead, you may overtake other vehicles even in areas where it is prohibited to do so.

Leaving plenty of space while driving, such as keeping enough distance from the vehicle ahead and giving consideration to passing clearance, gives a driver extra time for reacting to an incident, and as a result, he or she may cover up his, her or others' driving mistakes.
This traffic sign indicates "no right turn".
When an emergency vehicle approaches you on a one-way road, you must move to the right side of the road in order to give way to the emergency vehicle.
Seatbelts can help a driver be in a suitable driving posture and lessen the driver's fatigue during driving.
Automobiles and mopeds must not exceed a speed of 50 km/h on a road where there is a traffic sign as shown 50 km/h
When there is a streetcar stopped where there is no safety zone, a vehicle must stop behind the streetcar until all the passengers finish getting on and off or finish crossing the road.
While driving, it is good Iota driver to take a relaxed posture looking straight ahead and leaning lightly against the back of the seat.
If you come across someone who has been involved in an automobile accident, or a breakdown, it is important to have consideration for such a person, and you should help in any way possible.

When proceeding through a railway crossing, even if one train has just passed by in one direction, there may be another train approaching from the opposite direction immediately afterward. Therefore, drivers must be sure to check the safety of the opposite direction.
Even when proceeding on a one-way street, vehicles may not drive on the right hand side of the road.
Where a traffic sign as shown in the figure is posted, vehicles may make a left turn regardless of the traffic signal ahead.
When you make a right turn from a one-way road you must first approach the center of the road, then proceed to the position just short of the center of the intersection at a reduced speed.
The driver is not responsible for accidents  caused by passengers accidentally opening the car doors.
A traffic sign as shown in the figure indicates that drivers are required to sound the horn.
When approaching a pedestrian crossing, vehicles are not required to slow down and may continue to proceed at the same speed as before, if there are apparently no pedestrians nearby.

Driver's licenses are issued only to those people who have acquired not only the skills and knowledge required for safe driving, but also the abilities to foster better judgments of traffic conditions and the willingness to abide by laws.
If there is no  intersection and police officer giving the hand signal for stop, you must stop one meter before the police officer or traffic warden.
It is reasonable to assume that after seeing a ball bouncing out of the corner of a road, it is very likely that a child may dash out after the ball.
When the rider of the motorcycle gave the hand signal shown on the left, the vehicle approaching the rear of the motorcycle promptly steered to the right.
A traffic sign indicating "road closed"is to prohibit the passage of pedestrians to avoid danger , so automobiles may proceed.
You may wear footwear such as geta wooden sandals or high hills.
A safe distance between two vehicles would be the same as the braking distance.
Driver's licenses are classified into three different categories, namely, first-class license, second-class license, and moped  (motorized bicycle) license.

When executing a right turn at an intersection (except roundabout), an automobile must initially approach as close as possible to the center of the road and slow down to proceed closely inside the center point of the intersection. (Excluding cases when the automobile is proceeding on a one-way street.)
A vehicle must not execute a left or right tom at an intersection where there is traffic sign as shown in the figure.
On a road with a staggered signal, drivers must look at the signal ahead. They should not assume that the signal ahead will be timed to turn green when an oncoming vehicle starts moving.
When there is a flashing yellow traffic light ahead, vehicles must slow down and proceed.
At an intersection where mopeds must execute a two-step right turn, mopeds can execute a right turn when the green arrow points to the right.
You must proceed on the left side of "the center of the road," in areas where it is designated by this traffic sign shown on the left.
You must choose a safe speed within the speed limit depending on the traffic, weather, and visibility conditions.

In the situation shown in the figure, when traffic signal A at the intersection is green, vehicles proceeding in the direction indicated by the arrow may execute a left turn even if traffic signal B is red.
When driving by a vehicle which has stopped before a pedestrian crossing, you must slow down and pass beside the stopped vehicle before you can move ahead of it.
When you enter a parking space established alongside  the road, you should maneuver your vehicle as depicted by the arrows.
It is advisable to wear a motorcycle helmet wich bears the "S"or "JIS"mark designed for the safety of users.
When passing by a pedestrian, you could not maintain enough space between the pedestrian and your vehicle, so you slowed down.
When passing a school bus or kindergarten bus, which has stopped to drop the children off, you must always stop behind the bus and confirm safety.
The designated maximum speed on general roads is 60 km/h for regular passenger vehicles, but 50 km/h for regular trucks.
The Correct driving posture, the knees are slightly bent when depressing the clutch pedal and the elbows are slightly bent when holding the steering wheel

Because crossing the road, making a U-turn and reversing are movements against the flow of traffic, therefore, drivers must exercise caution so as not to interfere with the normal passage of pedestrians or other vehicles.

A four-wheeled vehicle with automatic transmission, even when the accelerator pedal is not being depressed, the car will move forward by itself unless the brake pedal is applied. This is known as "Creep" phenomenon.
When driving an automatic transmission vehicle and it seems that the vehicle is going to be stopped in traffic for a while, it is advisable to put the gearshift in the N position
Before changing lanes, drivers must signal after checking the rear view mirror to ensure safety to the rear.
You may exceed the regulated speed limit when you need to accelerate for overtaking other vehicles or changing lanes.
At the intersection without crosswalks, vehicles have priority over pedestrian who are going to cross the road.
You must not close in form the side or cut in front of the vehicle displaying the Hearing Person's mark shown on the left, except in cases where such actions must be taken to avoid dangers.
Do not offer alcohol to any person who may be driving soon.
When a traffic light indicated a  "flashing red light," you must stop at the stop line.
Wearing seatbelts helps reduce injury in cases of an accident.
A pavement marking as shown in the figure indicates a "bicycle crossing zone".
If a person applying for license renewal is the age of 65 or over at the renewal period expiration date, that person must take a senior driver's course within six months of the expiration date.
When exiting a parking lot located along a sidewalk, you must stop before crossing the sidewalk even if there is no pedestrian.
When you attempt to overtake vehicles ahead of you, you must first signal your direction indicator lamp and then check the front and rear for safety.
You may drive a vehicle with a broken muffler, because even though it is noisy, it would not pose any danger in driving.

Passing too close to or cutting in front of a regular vehicle that is displaying a sign indicating a novice driver, senior driver, learner driver or physically disabled driver is, in principle, prohibited.
On roads regulated by this traffic sign shown on the left, vehicles may not pass through the road, whereas pedestrians may pass through.

A vehicle must not change lanes or pass vehicles or mopeds for the purpose of overtaking at an intersection or within 30 meters before one (excluding cases when the vehicle is proceeding on a road with a right of way).
When passing near a pedestrian a driver must leave a safe, wide berth between the vehicle and the pedestrian or slow down.
When you saw a route bus, which had stopped at a bus stop, and signaling to start moving, you kept on driving by the side of the bus, sounding the car horn, because you were in a big hurry.
The term "slowing down" refers to reducing to a speed at which the vehicle can come to an immediate stop at any time, and that usually means driving at a speed of less than 10km/h.
When driving on the road where the traffic is light, you should only mind your own driving needs because other people and vehicles would not be inconvenienced by your conduct.
When a traffic signal turns green but the vehicle ahead does not move, a driver may sound the horn so as to urge the driver of the vehicle ahead to start.
Those who do not hold a driver's license must not drive automobiles or mopeds on the road, even for a very short distance.
This traffic sign regulated that mopeds must add here to the periphery of the intersection and use the two-step method to make a right turn.
For driving, you should use a hands-free cell-phone, which allows you to answer the phone without using your hands.
In areas where regulated by the traffic sign shown on the left, you may not change lanes for overtaking or passing.
A person, who has obtained regular driver's license may operate a regular two-wheeled motor vehicle.
It is important for drivers not to be selfish, but to have a give-and-take spirit, to consider others, and respect pedestrians and/or other drivers.
Driving an inadequately serviced vehicle would not be implicated as a cause for inducing accidents or inconvenience to others on the road.

When overtaking other vehicles on a road with good visibility, and having the width of less than 6 meters in each direction, you may cross over the yellow halfway line into the oncoming lane, if there is no oncoming vehicle.
Overtaking is not prohibited inside the tunnels with vehicular lanes.
The arrow shown in the figure indicates the correct way to execute a right turn.
Overtaking is prohibited near the top of an uphill or along a steep downward slope.
Vehicles must proceed very carefully on roads where a traffic sign as shown in the figure is displayed, because there is a danger of strong side winds that may make steering dificult.
Even when proceeding on a road where the vehicular lanes are designated by a yellow line, a vehicle may cross the line and change lanes so as to execute a left or right turn.
It is advisable to get into or out of the automobile through the left side door if traffic is heavy.
In areas designated as  "No crossing" or "No U-turn" you may not back up either.
When you saw a person walking with the aid of crutches ahead, you sounded your car horn to let him know that your vehicle was approaching him.
The driver of a four-wheeled vehicle has to wear a seat belt but the passenger sitting in the front seat does not.
Vehicles may not stop but are allowed to park in areas defined by these pavement markings shown on the left.
A driver may proceed while decelerating the vehicle's speed from 50 km/h to 20 km/h on a road where a traffic sign as shown in the figure is displayed.
When a vehicle is attempting to change lanes and a vehicle is approaching from behind, that vehicle should give way to the vehicle behind and not change lanes.

Motorized bicycles and light special equipment may proceed in lanes exclusive for buses. However, large motorcycles or similar vehicles may not proceed in such lanes except when making a left turn or an unavoidable situation arises.
Confirming safety too often is not advisable because it would lead you to drive slowly, and cause a traffic congestion.
When it is raining, both the reaction distance and the braking distance become longer.
A compulsory automobile liability insurance certificate and a mutual relief system insurance certificate are important documents to be kept safely at home.
When the gearshift of an automatic transmission vehicle is in the position of "P" or "N", the vehicle may move forward (creep effect).

Side strips refer to those strips provided on the side of the road that are delineated by a white line to provide spaces for pedestrians along the road having no sidewalk and to increase the utility of the vehicular road.
When the traffic is congested, it is better to proceed forward even if you would have to stop directly over the pedestrian crossing or bicycle crossing.
When parking an automatic transmission vehicle on an upward slope, the driver must put the gearshift lever in the "P" position after engage the parking brake firmly, while depressing the brake pedal.
You may drive across a pedestrian walkway designated as a walkway for school children, if you have received permission to cross from the school principal.
A moped must make a two-step right turn at a controlled intersection where there is a traffic sign as shown in the figure.

When approaching an intersection (except roundabout) that has no traffic signals and the two streets are the same width, a vehicle must not obstruct the progress of a vehicle approaching form the right.
You may drive a microbus carrying 11 passengers with a regular driver's license.
When proceeding on a steep downhill, you caught up to a slow-moving moped, so you overtook the moped.

When  you drive an automobile, not only do you need to acquire skills in driving, but also you must exercise caution when driving by pedestrians and vehicles, and take the standpoint of others into consideration.
When you drive beside a bicycle traveling on the side strip,  you do not have to keep a safe distance between you and the bicycle or reduce speed.
Drivers are required to obtain not only driving knowledge and skill, but also good morals as a member of society.
At a railway crossing without traffic signals, drivers must bring the vehicle to a complete stop, open a window, and perform a visual and aural check to ensure safety.
When an emergency vehicle is approaching, vehicles must stop on site wherever they are, and give way to the emergency vehicle.
When you attempt to proceed past a regular passenger vehicle which has stopped right before a bicycle crossing, you must slow down when moving ahead of  it.
To make a right or left turn at an intersection where traffic is light, it is permitted to signal just before the intersection.
In areas regulated by this traffic sign shown on the left, vehicles must turn back because the lane will lead to a dead end.
You must always stop when driving close to pedestrians.
A traffic sign as shown in the figure designates a road that is closed to regular passenger vehicles, large-size motorcycles and regular motorcycles only.
When riding a motorcycle, you should wear clothing that exposes as much of your skin as possible.
Regular motor vehicles can proceed straight through, and execute a left or right turn at an intersection where a traffic sign as shown in the figure is displayed.

When making a left turn, vehicles must move to the left edge of the road in advance and slow down while exercising due caution to two-wheeled vehicles proceeding on the left side of the road in order to avoid cutting them off.
A driver must not attempt to overtake when the vehicle ahead is about to change lanes. For example, to make a right turn.

When executing a right turn at an intersection where a traffic sign as shown in the figure is displayed, mopeds must initially approach from as close to the center of the road as possible (excluding one-way streets) and execute a right immediately inside the center point of the intersection.
You must attach a "Beginner's Mark" at the rear of the regular passenger vehicle when you practice driving with a learner's permit on public roads.
When you attempt to shift lanes, you must first signal your intention and then check the traffic conditions behind you with the mirrors for safety.
Changing lanes or passing an automobile or motorized bicycle to overtake is prohibited in tunnels without vehicular lanes.
When turning to the right or left, you only have to consider dangers to the front of the car because the rear wheels of the vehicle follow the same paths as the front wheel.
lf there is a person crossing a pedestrian crossing, and he or she stops when a vehicle approaches, the vehicle may continue to proceed as before.
A vehicle must stop if a pedestrian is crossing a pedestrian crossing, It can, however, continue to proceed at a low speed a pedestrian is about to cross.
Anyone who instigates other people to engage in dangerous driving will have his/her driver's license revoked even if he/she has not been actually driving the vehicle.
You must not serve or offer alcoholic beverages to a person who is going to drive.
A traffic sign as shown in the figure designates either a pedestrian crossing or bicycle crossing.
It is not necessary for a driver to signal when slowing down or coming to a stop, because there are no ways to signal these movements.
It is not necessary to slow down near the top of an uphill.
Correct use of child seats dramatically reduces injury in the event of an accident and prevents children from interfering with driving.
When passing by a bicycle, you do not have to exercise caution as much as you do for a pedestrian.
Vehicles and mopeds may not pass through roads regulated by this traffic sign shown on the left.

If a sign board showing a blue arrow pointing left on a white background (left turn permitted) is mounted at the left side of the road or on the traffic signal, vehicles may turn left even when signal ahed of  them is read or yellow
An automobile executing a left or right turn must not proceed in a vehicular lane where there is a pavement marking as shown in the figure.
The distance from the point at which the driver identifies danger to the point at which the brake pedal is depressed and the brake starts to operate is called the "reaction distance".
When a driver notices children playing on a road, the driver may proceed without slowing down if he/she sounds the horn to alert the children.
It is advisable for automobiles to proceed at the maximum speed limit in order to make traffic flow smoothly.
You accelerated to pass a vehicle parked on your side of the road you were traveling, before the oncoming vehicle had time to pass the section of the parked vehicle.
On roads with this sign, cargo vehicles with a maximum loading capacity of over 3 tons and large special vehicles cannot use this road.
When a child is walking unattended, you should sound your car horn and pass the child as fast as possible.
When giving way to an emergency vehicle, a vehicle must move to the left side of the road even when proceeding on a one-way road.
The hand signal shown in the figure means that the rider will make a left turn or change to the left lane.
Once you have stopped before entering a railroad crossing and confirmed that no train is approaching, you may enter the railroad crossing regardless of the traffic conditions ahead of it.
This traffic sign designates "no overtaking."
When you have to make a sudden stop in a vehicle equipped with the anti-lock brake system, you should jam on the brake pedal and continue to depress the brake pedal until it comes to a complete stop.
Driver's license are classified into three types; the first-class license, the second-class license and the moped license.

When a driver approaches is pedestrian crossing and is not sure whether or not there are pedestrians crossing, he or she must reduce speed enough to be able to stop before entering the pedestrian crossing.

Even when the traffic light to which a motor vehicle is facing at an intersection is red, the motor vehicle may proceed in the direction of the arrow (when the arrow is pointing to the right, the motor vehicle also may turn around) if a green arrow light is simultaneously on.
When driving a four-wheeled vehicle with a child in the front seat,  you do not have to use a child seat because you can always keep an eye on the child sitting right beside you.

Even when there are people getting on or off a streetcar at a streetcar stop where there is no safety zone, a vehicle may slow down and continue to proceed if there is a clearance of 1.5 meters or more between the vehicle and the streetcar
When a police officer holds a flashlight straight up over the head, this signal is equivalent to a yellow traffic light for the traffic moving parallel to the movement to the flashlight.
Flashing yellow light, you may proceed  while exercising due caution with regards to other traffics.

A traffic warden was giving a hand signal to "stop" at an intersection with a traffic light. However, the driver continued to proceed through the intersection because the traffic light was indicating a green light.
On roads with two vehicular lanes in the same direction slow moving vehicles should use the left lane, and faster ones should use the right lane.
You must not apply sudden braking unless it is inevitable that you do so in order to alleviate danger.
It is not necessary to slow down on a steep down slope, if there is no traffic designating "Slow Down"
Vehicles other than regular passenger vehicles may proceed on a road where there is a traffic sign as shown in the figure.
You may not overtake another vehicle ahead when that vehicle is attempt in to change lanes to execute a right turn.
Even when your compulsory automobile liability insurance certificate has expired, you may drive your vehicle as long as the motor vehicle inspection certificate is valid.
Vehicles do not have to stop immediately before crossing sidewalks or side strips if no pedestrians are present.
A driver needs to check the safety to the rear not only by using the rear view mirror, but in some cases also by checking the side where there may be danger directly with his or her eyes.

There is no guarantee that driving vehicles on public roads is absolutely safe. This is why you should always drive carefully and exercise due caution in the surrounding to traffic to avoid dangerous situations.
When driving a long distance, it is advisable to take a rest every two hours.
When being overtaken by the vehicle behind, it is safe not to increase speed and give may until the vehicle completes overtaking, regardless of the type of that vehicle.

If an emergency vehicle is approaching a location that is not an intersection or near an intersection, vehicles proceeding towards that location must move to the left side of the road and come to a stop in order to give way to the emergency vehicle.
The angle of the back rest of the driver's seat should be adjusted so that the elbows are slightly bent when holding the steering wheel.
At an intersection with a traffic signal and a stop line  marked on the road, you should stop immediately before the stop line.
Improper use of child seat would render in ineffective, so follow the manufacturer's instruction manual carefully to use it properly.
It is dangerous to use a cell phone or watch the screen of the care navigation system while driving, because you will have diminished attention to the surrounding traffic.
Drivers must obey all the necessary instructions of police officers about how to proceed, etc.
Apart from acquiring driving skilï½Œs and learning traffic rules and regulations, drivers are required to show consideration for other road users, as members of society.
When the vehicle ahead is attempting to overtake another vehicle, you must not attempt to overtake, or even start to overtake the vehicle which is about to overtake the other vehicle.
